intro: Hemiphues bellidioides var. affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hemiphues, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often have a glandular surface, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
